account_list.create_first_account_with: Let's create your first account with

error.account_does_not_exist: This account does not exist anymore.

welcome.get_started_text: Hi there! Welcome to rehash: the password manager that does not save your passwords. Before we create your vault, let's go through a few introductory steps to ensure you have the best possible experience. If you already know about rehash, feel free to skip this introduction using the options at the very bottom.
welcome.im_already_familiar_text: Great! Then let's get straight to creating your new vault.

language.set_your_preferred_language_text: We tried to automatically detect your preferred language. If that did not turn out to be the right one, you can change it here.

what_is_rehash.how_does_it_work_text: rehash works completely offline and generates your password from your vault password, the URL of the website and your username on that website. To ensure that there is no way to guess your vault password from the generated password, rehash uses a cryptographic hash function to generate your passwords. To get a feeling for how this works, try it out by clicking these buttons!
what_is_rehash.cross_device_generation: This process of generating your password works the same across different devices. This means, that by entering the same URL and username in a vault with the same vault password, you will always get the same resulting password. This way you can easily access your passwords across devices without having to upload your vault to a cloud service.
what_is_rehash.next_steps: In the next steps we will be configuring your new local vault where your accounts will be stored.

encrypt_vault.encrypt_vault_text: This setting controls if your vault gets encrypted when saving. You should probably leave this enabled. Disabling it will allow an attacker to see all your websites and usernames in plain text if your vault should become accessible to them. Your passwords will not be visible, as they require your vault password to be generated.

vault_settings.configure_your_vault_text: The generator difficulty determines how much time it takes to generate a password. We provide you with a sensible recommended setting, giving you a good trade-off between security and generation time. You can try out the time it takes to generate a password using the "Measure Difficulty" button.
vault_settings.this_changes_all_your_passwords_text: Keep in mind that changing these settings will change how the generator derives your passwords, so to generate the same password across devices you will have to generate them using the same difficulty setting on both devices.

create_your_vault.set_password_text: You're almost done! The final step is to choose a strong password for your vault. This is the password from which all your other passwords will be derived, so choose a very strong password here.

password_prompt.unlock_your_vault_text: Enter your password to unlock your vault.

import_error.unknown_format: Sorry, this file could not be imported. The file format is unknown.
import_error.different_master_password: Sorry, this file was exported using a different vault password. The exported vault could not be decrypted.
